titles.title: Anti "Kiddie-Pack" Act
To restrict the sale of cigarettes in packages of less than 15 cigarettes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 4/30/1998--Introduced. Anti "Kiddie-Pack" Act - Prohibits offering cigarettes for sale in packages containing fewer than 15 cigarettes and offered for sale to the consumer at less than $2. Considers a violation to be a violation of provisions of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act relating to prohibited acts.
